content.rendered:
Hello people, so it seems like you all went large on Genesis Camp last weekend so I’ve gone big too with a mega recap (or should that be recamp, ha).

Plus I’ve got a new (free) theme tease from Rafal Tomal, an awesome new site in the showcase, plus that smart lady Carrie Dils talks pricing.

It’s all here people, it’s all here. (Oh and apologies if all the YouTube videos kill your browser).

Genesis Camp Mega Recap

So Genesis Camp has been and gone and you can either browse the YouTube channel with all the Genesis Camp presentations or scroll (and scroll some more) and revisit any of your favourites or awesome talks you might’ve missed below.

All in all over 600 people tuned in for the live broadcasts, so I think we’ll put that one down as a success 🙂

Huge congrats to everyone involved!

1. Genesis Camp Opening

2. Ready for Camp?

3. Genesis Camp Development Workflow

4. Troy Dean Recurring Revenue

5. Design – Branding Logos & File Types

6. Chris Lema – Coffee is for closers

7. The Essential Mac Setup

8. Wes Linda Exploring What’s possible with Genesis

9. David Wang – Keeping local, staging and production sites in sync

10. Jurgen Strauss – Leverage Time and Money with Web Power

11. Warren Denley – Dealing with DIY Clients

12. Heather Porter – Getting Your Name out There

13. High level View of Web and WordPress Development

14. Genesis and accessibility

15. Caching WordPress with the Transients API

16. VVV Vagrant – Genesis Camp

17. Animated Search Form in Header Right in Genesis

18. Susan Ramsey – looking for some support?

19. Jo Waltham How do you find the hook you need?

20. Genesis UK Podcast

21. Tweak your Genesis theme

22. Genesis Camp Community Message by Lauren Mancke

23. Genesis Camp – Genesis Child Theme – David Laietta

24. Erin Flynn – Dealing with Nightmare Clients

25. Joe Dooley – Development for Agencies

26. Quality Code by Design with Tonya

27. 101 ways to elevate and demand higher fees

28. Let’s Not Reinvent the Wheel – Leveraging 3rd party code

29. Hot Toddy – A WordPress and Genesis Workflow with Bourbon

Download the Genesis starter theme and DesktopServer blueprint that Dave mentions in his talk (available for a limited time).

30. David Decker – Globalize it!

31. Panel – Selling Maintenance Plans

32. Mike Hemberger – Client-Proofing Your Site with Metaboxes and Fields

33. Officehours.fm with Carrie Dils, Shay Bochs, Jeni Elliot

34. Panel – Different Ways of Working

35. Helena Denley: Leveraging Your Skills – Moving From One On One Client Work To Creating Your First Online Course

36. Understanding Genesis Hooks with Chris Cochran

37. From Mockup to Genesis: How to Become a Developer’s Best Friend

And you can now download the slides from Andrea’s talk too.

38. Genesis Camp Closing Remarks

(If you were a speaker and you want me to add your notes / slides below the video on this post just give me a shout or post them in the comments below and I’ll update it).

Themes

Rafal Tomal teases us with a new Genesis child theme that will be available free from his site soon:

This #genesiswp child theme will be available for FREE on my website soon: https://t.co/Vh9QzTqwX4 – check it out.

— Rafal Tomal (@RafalTomal) July 17, 2015

Showcase

Beautiful new site from Andrea Whitmer (and design by Design Eat Repeat) for diaryofarecipecollector.com

Almost forgot – launched a new #genesiswp theme for @jarendubois & it’s beautiful! Great design by @designeatrepeat http://t.co/9aSgb1VUZW

— Andrea Whitmer (@nutsandbolts) July 17, 2015

Podcasts

Away from all the Genesis Camp podcasts and general entertainment, there was a also a great chat between Carrie Dils and Kirk Bowman on The Art of Value podcast on the subject of pricing (also, doesn’t The Art of Value have the best podcast intro music?).

The Story of My Pricing Journey with Carrie Dils http://t.co/szblAYuFmK (Correct link) #WordPress #GenesisWP @cdils pic.twitter.com/t9qYfBgoTy

— Kirk Bowman (@ArtOfValue) July 21, 2015

Plus, because you can’t keep a good lady down, Carrie Dils also took the time to chat to UK Genesis favourite Ben Furfie on making the transition from freelancer to corporate on the OfficeHours.fm podcast.

Episode 69 with @ic_ben is LIVE! Tune in at http://t.co/rOsI2ft4eU Tag your questions with #officefm

— Office Hours Podcast (@officehoursfm) July 23, 2015

And finally…

I just wanted to give a quick shout out to Robin Cornett and her new SuperSide Me mobile menu plugin, which looks awesome and I look forward to trying on a Genesis project soon 🙂

Love this great plugin from @robincornett! #genesiswp https://t.co/ITurNRL45F

— Andrea Whitmer (@nutsandbolts) July 23, 2015

And that’s all for this week…

Next week though I have a very special surprise for you all with an interview (and giveaway) from the one and only Lindsey Riel over at Pretty Darn Cute and it’s good one I promise you.

So, if you haven’t already, I strongly encourage you to go ahead and use that pretty form below subscribe to make sure you don’t miss out 🙂

PS If you had a favourite talk at Genesis Camp and want to give it a shout out below, knock yourself out in the comment section and let’s give that person / people some love.

excerpt.rendered: Genesis Camp recap, a new free theme tease from Rafal Tomal, plus Carrie Dils talks pricing. That’s right, it’s This Week in Genesis #12…
